availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, foundryman. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Ann Glover Hikes in Jefferson County on October 31, 1854. Father of Annie Hike. Foundryman with his father-in-law, William E. Glover, in Louisville in 1860. Resident of Louisville in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 2, p. 967.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 8, p. 94B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County, 1853-1860, film no. 000482708, page 3.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 5th Congressional District, Jefferson County, Vol. 3, July 1863, p. 107 (p. 217 of microfilm), (Accessed via ancestry.com on June 8, 2020).
Find A Grave, "John L Hikes (1824-1873)," Memorial 8195412, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8195412 (accessed May 16, 2017).
